name: Ruby
description: Ruby is our default programming language for backend services.

name: TypeScript
description:
TypeScript is our default programming language for frontend services.

The added types on top of JavaScript have continuously proven very helpful during development of frontend applications. It is also embraced by the wider frontend community.

name: RSpec
description: RSpec is our default testing framework for Ruby since it offers all the required functionality out of the box and has the most easily readable syntax.

name: Jest
description: Jest is our default testing framework for TypeScript.

name: Pact
description: Contract testing seems to be the better alternative to true E2E tests. Pact offers an implementation of this technique in a variety of programming languages.

name: Pair Programming
description: Pair programming is a technique that yields far better code quality than just peer reviews. It should be employed in all cases where non-trivial problems are solved during software development.

name: Test-Driven-Development
description: Test-Driven-Development is not just a technique for a guaranteed 100% test coverage. It also forces the author to think about his design before starting to implement. This gives the author immediate feedback on his design
column6: which ultimately leads to much better software quality. TDD should therefore be practiced whenever possible.

name: OpenAPI
description: Specifying how your API behaves yields similar advantages to TDD. OpenAPI has proven to be a good standard for those specifications. It also aids in generating documentation for your APIs
column6: which is very helpful for other everyone else in the organization.

name: committee
description:
committee is a Ruby library that verifies your requests and responses against your OpenAPI specification. This guarantees that only valid requests are processed and only valid responses are returned by your HTTP API.

Unless there are performance problems
column6: those checks should always be enabled for every request and response handled by your service.
